PipelineGeneset.py - utility tasks for dealing with ENSEMBL gene sets¶

Most of this tasks take a geneset (.gtf.gz) from ENSEMBL as input.

PipelineGeneset.connectToUCSC()¶

connect to UCSC mysql database.

PipelineGeneset.importRefSeqFromUCSC(infile, outfile, remove_duplicates=True)¶

import gene set from UCSC database based on refseq mappings.

Outputs a gtf-formatted file a la ENSEMBL.

Depending on remove_duplicates, duplicate mappings are either removed or kept.

Matches to chr_random are ignored (as does ENSEMBL).

Note that this approach does not work as a gene set, as refseq maps are not real gene builds and unalignable parts cause differences that are not reconcilable.

PipelineGeneset.annotateGenome(infile, outfile, only_proteincoding=False)¶

annotate genomic regions with reference gene set.

infile is an ENSEMBL gtf file. Only considers protein coding genes, if only_proteincoding is set.

The method applies the following filters: * Exons from different transcripts in each gene are merged by overlap. * In case of overlapping genes, only take the longest (in genomic coordinates) is kept.

The task outputs a gff formatted file in outfile. For more information, see documentation for the script gtf2gff.py under the option --method=genome.

PipelineGeneset.annotateGeneStructure(infile, outfile, only_proteincoding=False)¶

annotate genomic regions with reference gene set.

infile is an ENSEMBL gtf file. Only considers protein coding genes, if only_proteincoding is set.

The method applies the following filters: * If there are multiple transcripts in a gene, a representative transcript is kept. * In case of overlapping genes, only take the longest (in genomic coordinates) is kept.

The task outputs a gff formatted file in outfile. For more information, see documentation for the script gtf2gff.py under the option --method=genes.

PipelineGeneset.buildFlatGeneSet(infile, outfile)¶

build a flattened gene set.

All transcripts in a gene are merged into a single transcript.

infile is an ENSEMBL gtf file.

PipelineGeneset.buildProteinCodingGenes(infile, outfile)¶

build a collection of exons from the protein-coding section of the ENSEMBL gene set.

The exons include both CDS and UTR.

infile is an ENSEMBL gtf file.

The set is filtered in the same way as in buildGeneRegions().

PipelineGeneset.loadGeneInformation(infile, outfile, only_proteincoding=False)¶

load gene information gleaned from the attributes in the gene set gtf file.

infile is an ENSEMBL gtf file.

PipelineGeneset.loadTranscriptInformation(infile, outfile, only_proteincoding=False)¶

load the transcript set.

infile is an ENSEMBL gtf file.

PipelineGeneset.buildCDNAFasta(infile, outfile)¶

load ENSEMBL cdna FASTA file

infile is an ENSEMBL cdna file.

PipelineGeneset.buildPeptideFasta(infile, outfile)¶

create ENSEMBL peptide file

infile is an ENSEMBL .pep.all.fa.gz file.

PipelineGeneset.loadPeptideSequences(infile, outfile)¶

load ENSEMBL peptide file into database

infile is an ENSEMBL .pep.all.fa.gz file.

PipelineGeneset.buildCDSFasta(infile, outfile)¶

load ENSEMBL cdna FASTA file

infile is an ENSEMBL cdna file.

PipelineGeneset.loadGeneStats(infile, outfile)¶

load gene statistics to database.

The infile is the outfile from buildGenes()

PipelineGeneset.buildExons(infile, outfile)¶

build a collection of transcripts from the ENSEMBL gene set.

Only the exon portion is kept.

PipelineGeneset.buildCodingExons(infile, outfile)¶

build a collection of transcripts from the protein-coding portion of the ENSEMBL gene set.

All exons are kept

PipelineGeneset.buildNonCodingExons(infile, outfile)¶

build a collection of transcripts from the non-coding portion of the ENSEMBL gene set.

All exons are kept

PipelineGeneset.buildLincRNAExons(infile, outfile)¶

build a collection of transcripts from the LincRNA portion of the ENSEMBL gene set. All exons are kept

PipelineGeneset.buildCDS(infile, outfile)¶

build a collection of transcripts from the protein-coding section of the ENSEMBL gene set.

Only CDS exons are parts of exons are output - UTR’s are removed.

Removes any transcripts with very long (> 3Mb) introns.

PipelineGeneset.loadTranscripts(infile, outfile)¶

load the transcript set into the database.

PipelineGeneset.loadTranscript2Gene(infile, outfile)¶

build and load a map of transcript to gene from gtf file

PipelineGeneset.loadTranscriptStats(infile, outfile)¶

load gene statistics to database.

The infile is the outfile from buildTranscripts()

PipelineGeneset.loadProteinStats(infile, outfile)¶

load protein statistics to database.

The infile is an ENSEMBL peptide file.

PipelineGeneset.buildPromotorRegions(infile, outfile)¶

annotate promotor regions from reference gene set.

PipelineGeneset.buildTSSRegions(infile, outfile)¶

annotate transcription start sites from reference gene set.

Similar to promotors, except that the witdth is set to 1.

PipelineGeneset.buildOverlapWithEnsembl(infile, outfile, filename_bed)¶

compute overlap of genes in infile with intervals in filename_bed and load into database.

If filename_bed has multiple tracks the overlap will be computed for each track separately.

infile is the output from buildGenes().

PipelineGeneset.compareGeneSets(infiles, outfile)¶

compute overlap of genes, exons and transcripts in infiles

infiles are protein coding gene sets.

PipelineGeneset.buildPseudogenes(infiles, outfile)¶

annotate genomic regions with reference gene set.

infile is an ENSEMBL gtf file.

This task selects all pseudogenic transcripts in a single file.

Pseudogenes are:

  • gene_type or transcript_type contains the phrase “pseudo”. This taken from the database.
  • feature ‘processed_transcript’ with similarity to protein coding genes. Similarity is assessed by aligning with exonerate.

Pseudogenic transcripts can overlap with protein coding transcripts.

PipelineGeneset.buildNUMTs(infile, outfile)¶

build annotation with nuclear mitochondrial sequences.

map mitochondrial chromosome against genome using exonerate

PipelineGeneset.sortGTF(infile, outfile, order='contig+gene')¶

sort a gtf file - the sorting is performed on the cluster.

Ssee gtf2gtf.py for valid options for order.

PipelineGeneset.buildGenomicFunctionalAnnotation(gtffile, dbh, outfiles)¶

output a bed file with genomic regions with functional annotations.

The regions for each gene are given in the gtf file.

Each bed entry is a gene territory. Bed entries are labeled by functional annotations associated with a gene.

Ambiguities in territories are resolved by outputting annotations for all genes within a territory.

The output file contains annotations for both GO and GOSlim. These are prefixed by go: and goslim:.
